parameters.name: DryRun
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to perform a dry run. Valid values:

- **true**: performs a dry run. The system prechecks whether your AccessKey pair is valid, whether the RAM user is authorized, and whether the required parameters are specified. If the request fails the dry run, an error message is returned. If the request passes the dry run, the `DryRunOperation` error code is returned.
- **false** (default): performs a dry run and sends the request. If the request passes the dry run, a 2xx HTTP status code is returned and the operation is performed.

parameters.name: InstanceChargeType
parameters.description: The billing method of the NAT gateway. Set the value to **PostPaid**, which specifies the pay-as-you-go billing method.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description:
The name of the NAT gateway. 

The name must be 1 to 128 characters in length, and cannot start with `http://` or `https://`. 

If this parameter is not set, the system automatically assigns a name to the NAT gateway.

parameters.name: NatGatewayId
parameters.description: The ID of the NAT gateway.

parameters.name: NatType
parameters.description: The type of NAT gateway. Set the value to **Enhanced** (enhanced NAT gateway).

parameters.name: NetworkType
parameters.description:
The type of the NAT gateway. Valid values:

*   **internet**: an Internet NAT gateway
*   **intranet**: a VPC NAT gateway

parameters.name: PageNumber
parameters.description: The number of the page to return. Default value: **1**.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: The number of entries to return on each page. Maximum value: **50**. Default value: **10**.

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description:
The region ID of the NAT gateways that you want to query.

You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~36063~~) operation to query the most recent region list.

parameters.name: ResourceGroupId
parameters.description: The ID of the resource group to which the NAT gateway belongs.

parameters.name: Spec
parameters.description: The size of the NAT gateway. Ignore this parameter.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description:
The status of the NAT gateway. Valid values:

*   **Creating**: After you send a request to create a NAT gateway, the system creates the NAT gateway in the background. The NAT gateway remains in the **Creating** state until the operation is completed.
*   **Available**: The NAT gateway remains in a stable state after the NAT gateway is created.
*   **Modifying**: After you send a request to modify a NAT gateway, the system modifies the NAT gateway in the background. The NAT gateway remains in the **Modifying** state until the operation is completed.
*   **Deleting**: After you send a request to delete a NAT gateway, the system deletes the NAT gateway in the background. The NAT gateway remains in the **Deleting** state until the operation is completed.
*   **Converting**: After you send a request to upgrade a standard NAT gateway to an enhanced NAT gateway, the system upgrades the NAT gateway in the background. The NAT gateway remains in the **Converting** state until the operation is completed.

parameters.name: VpcId
parameters.description: The ID of the VPC to which the NAT gateway belongs.

parameters.name: ZoneId
parameters.description: The ID of the zone to which the NAT gateway belongs.
